website_summaries.verdict: There's quite a lot to like about Logitech's new Gaming Mouse G500, but with a competing mouse from Microsoft offering its own set of features, gamers now have some choices to make. The G500 will appeal to performance-driven shooter fans. The choice is less clear for other kinds of PC gamers.
pros: All of the same features we love about the older G5 Laser Mouse
requisite, ludicrously high sensor DPI maximum
cons: Competing Microsoft mouse in the same price range offers a different set of compelling features

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse started having connection issues with my computer after about 3 months. Now it does not even power up when plugged into the USB port. And, yes, I have tried it with several ports on several devices. I understand that this was a good/used unit but it should have lasted longer than four months. My previous mouse, a Logitech G5, lasted over a decade and I was assuming that this one would make it at least that long. I suppose it is my fault for making an assumption. I do not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Fubar

customer_reviews.title: Great quality after 11 years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse back in 2009 and it's still as great today as it was 11 years ago. Some people complain about build quality, but my cord and mouse are working flawlessly. I have my buttons all programmed to do the things I need. I am surprised to still see this thing for sale. I suspect I wouldn't purchase it again today if I was looking for a mouse as there are others that are most likely more ergonomic but I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alex M Moffitt

customer_reviews.title: I love its Dual Mode wheel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse nearly 8 years ago when my older Logitech LX700 KB/Mouse Combo died after 10 years of use.I replaced the LX700 with a Logitech G110 Keyboard, and this G500 Gaming Mouse.For the past 8 years, it has been flawless and worked exceptionally well. I love its Dual Mode wheel, which allows toggling the wheel between a smooth scroll, and a clicky scroll; while it also has the Tilt Wheel feature, which allows you to tilt the wheel to the left or right to act as extra mouse buttons.The DPI is very fast and very responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Beloved Belongings

customer_reviews.title: Very expensive mouse, great quality and died early
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these mouses. Unfortunately, both has the same double click issue. I have been using these mouses for many years. It's so sad that I have to criticize them like this. Both mouses lasted for about 1-2 years. They are still functional except the left click issue. How can Logitech not foresee this problem? I saw a couple of solutions online to fix this, but given that I am not a mechanical guy, I do not know how to work with tiny stuffs. With such price, the mouse should last longer and die from more catastrophic damages. I will not spend money on this mouse again. I have totally given up on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect while it was alive.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse has been performing like a champ until today when it started dying randomly. Unplugging and replugging it solves the problem but only temporarily. To debug, I first tried different USB ports and when other mice worked just fine while this mouse kept dying even on another computer at which point, I pronounced her dead, too early for her age. She leaves behind a lonely mousepad and an empty USB port. She was 5 years old.
customer_reviews.author: vladinecko

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse while it works but it's not durable
customer_reviews.text: I've have Microsoft mice that are 10+ years old still going strong. My first Logitech G500 failed after a couple years, its new replacement failed after a year. I now have nothing to show for the money I spent on this mouse since its out of warranty. They are nice mice when they work, lots of customizable buttons but this mouse isn't worth high cost Logitech wants since they don't last. For my new mouse, I spent well under twenty bucks and got this one
customer_reviews.author: Trusted Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse with just the right buttons/placement to play my ...
customer_reviews.text: The finish is wearing off because I use it so much. Great mouse with just the right buttons/placement to play my games effectively. I have now had this mouse in CONSTANT use for 4 years. I was surprised to look back on my order and notice the time, because the mouse still performs flawlessly and only the finish has faded to black where my hand rests on it. I am surprised at the $150 price point, since I bought it for less than half that, but as a steady mouse that will fit all of your needs without being too unnecessarily glitzy (12,000 dpi on the new proteus? I can barely control 4,000 and my reflexes are gamer-quick.)
customer_reviews.author: Sabo

customer_reviews.title: Takes a while to get used to
customer_reviews.text: After using this mouse for a couple months, I've decided it's a very nice mouse. At first, I didn't really like it because the contours of the mouse didn't fit my hand as well as previous mice. However, that's something that varies from person to person and after a while, you get comfortable with it. It's very responsive, and I like that you can change the weight of it to fit your preference. Personally, I loaded it up with the heaviest weights it came with. The sensitivity buttons are nice but I honestly don't use them very much. All the buttons are in good spots ergonomically. One of the best mice for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Angrypencils

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a year now with no issues. The mouse is responsive, I prefer the high weight that adjustable weights allows, the buttons are easy to distinguish by feel. The scroll is very "loose" even without turning on infinite scroll, which required some adjustment but isn't a problem for me anymore. The software is flexible, but simple enough to configure anything in seconds without having to fiddle with things. If my mouse died tomorrow I'd buy another one in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: A excellent gaming mouse!
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech G500 mouse doesn't disappoint as a gaming mouse. The build quality is superb and it's very comfortable to hold. I mostly play Battlefield 3 with this baby, and sniping is super easy with this mouse. I love the red lights on the mouse, which is adjustable and shows your mouse speed. The mouse offers different weights, but I think that is more of a gimmick, I just use the mouse without any weight and never had a problem. The scroll wheel can be toggled between smooth scrolling or fine finer scrolling, which is a awesome feature. The mouse also looks cool, with a painted "splash" kind of look. Overall, for the price, this mouse is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: G. Tan

customer_reviews.title: Almost great
customer_reviews.text: I've been pretty happy with the responsiveness of this mouse with my laptop. I got this corded type because it is better for fine work like digitizing embroidery patterns on the computer. My only complaint is that the cord has tended to show wear and slight fraying, which surprised me for a high-end mouse. The explanations for all the settings aren't documented that well, but I suppose there are other sources on the internet to find out what they do. This has weights to change the heft of the mouse, but I couldn't tell a big difference there and finally just went with an intermediate amount of weight.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mouse! Comes with an array of tiny weights ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mouse! Comes with an array of tiny weights that you can add to it for your comfort. I also love the additional extra buttons and shortcut keys you can assign to it. Unfortunately, these don't seem to last very long. I've gone through about 3 mice so far. One broke because the right click ceased working and another the left click would double click multiple times... which is HIGHLY annoying. It's a great mouse when it works, I'm just not sure about the longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: I miss you...
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is amazing. It lasted me 7 years. That's a good deal for the 40$ I bought it for. This mouse did everything I wanted it to. It was comfortable for my half palm and half fingertip grip. I bought the 502G Hero Logitech since I couldn't find this one again. Unfortunately they shipped me a piece of hot trash because after just 10 months the left mouse button started sticking and I have to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Durability concerns
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for about two years. I like the grip and the buttons (especially the sensitivity settings) but have had some serious issues with reliability and durability: 1. The fabric covering to the wire easily frays and starts coming off. 2. The connection between the USB connector and wire is not reliable, requiring frequent repositioning to actually keep my mouse connected to my computer 3. The buttons are only so-so in terms of reliably clicking. Part of this may be wear and tear - I transport my mouse to and from work every day. But I would have expected rather better durability for the price point and manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: SU

customer_reviews.title: Best Mouse I've Used
customer_reviews.text: I've had this mouse for about a year now, decided to buy it after reading some reviews online. I do a lot of competitive gaming so I needed something durable that responds well. This mouse does all of that. I've had zero issues with it since I bought it. You can control the speed of the cursor, add extra weights to it if you like a heavier feel, and adjust your scroll mode. The only problem I have is that I can't program the red button on the side to use it for my PTT key in vent like I could with my last mouse. It's kind of frustrating, but I'll live.
customer_reviews.author: Fay W.

customer_reviews.title: Big hands? No worry!
customer_reviews.text: The most solid mouse I've ever used ever. Although I'm not as hardcore of a gamer I used to be, I've been through two Razer mice (deathadder) and then wanted to try something new. Very glad I did. The custom settings, features, feel, and construction are all top-notch! It's because of this mouse that I bought a similar one from logitech for work. The only issue I ran into is the plastic sheath that protects the USB cable split at one of the bends (was shipped that way) and the cable pokes out. Just looks bad, doesn't do anything to the way it works.
customer_reviews.author: Hun Gopher

customer_reviews.title: I enjoyed it when it did work!
customer_reviews.text: It was great while it lasted. I ordered this mouse sometime in August 2011. I liked the ideal of being able to add weight to the mouse so it wouldn't feel like a toy in my hand. I never got around to programming the programmable buttons, so I can't tell you why I spent so much money on this thing. Sometime around June 2014 the left click button started to malfunction; which, makes playing games with this thing very difficult. If I could do it all over again I would just buy a decent $10.
customer_reviews.author: D. Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Love this mouse
customer_reviews.text: Have all the buttons I need with out having so many, things get cluttered. I have all the weights so it feels heavy (I like it this way). I use it for FPS. I don't like the roll bar for toggling guns, so I programmed the two buttons on the side for that and use my thumb to change them now. The roller would change all the time as it is very sensitive and I would get killed because of it at first. Great mouse. I have no complaints. I chose this after reviewing SEVERAL sites on the best gaming mouse.
customer_reviews.author: benniehanas

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Gaming software crashing due to DVD drive
customer_reviews.text: The one thing I couldn't tell from the specs and pics is that the black grip on both sides of the mouse is textured plastic or rubber. It's also fairly heavy without the weights installed. I also had a hard time installing the Logitech Gaming software. It would simply freeze during installation and the whole computer would be unresponsive. After lots of troubleshooting and research online, it was due to my Lite-On DVD burner. Once I disconnected that, the installation proceeded flawlessly. My motherboard is the Asus Maximus V Gene. Taking 2 stars off for my aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Heavy on the mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I like a heavy mouse. I've never cared for a lightweight wimpy mouse at all. This G500 replaces an old G5 Logitech I've had for many years. It still works fine but it has started to look pretty rough around the edges. I expect that this G500 will last for many years as well but just in case the G5 has been put away on standby. One thing I really like about this line is the ability to fine tune the weight of the mouse to your needs. Build quality is very good and I'm not easy on my mice, never had issues with the G5 and so fart the G500 is flawless. Keep up the good work.
customer_reviews.author: El Tee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mouse for gaming and for internet use.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is awesome for the fact that it has a few programmable buttons. It's also got turbo-scroll that you can activate and deactivate as you like. You can save profiles onto it because of it's onboard memory which is awesome if you use more than one computer. With the profile you can save what each button does and the sensitivity of the pointers movement to use on a different computer. It also has some weights that you can add to change the feel of the mouse in your hand but I always leave them out, to lessen any strain on my wrist by keeping it light.
customer_reviews.author: F. S.

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. It is heavy enough so that it doesn't get moved around by the cord stiffness (if there was any) and still light enough to move without fatigue. It is very customizable and the adjustable on-the-fly dpi settings are great for games like BF3 where you want to zoom in with a sniper rifle or something. The included weights are a plus but I don't use them. I do like the woven cord because it makes it more durable and much less likely to fray. I don't use mine with a pad but I am sure it would work well with one too. Great mouse for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great even if you're not a gamer.
customer_reviews.text: I'm only a casual computer gamer at best and was looking for a corded mouse that wasn't cheap, but I also didn't want to spend $100+ on a gaming mouse just to get the quality I wanted. The G500 fits all my needs and surpasses all my expectations. I love that the scroll wheel can be "smooth" or "clicky" just by pressing one button. Changing the Dpi of the laser without having to go through computer settings is very convenient. And the three buttons on the side make surfing the web and certain business practices easier and more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: JRC

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I got this mouse on sale and for free (thanks to bing rewards) and all I can say this is a fabulous mouse even compared to the more expensive mouse varities. What's great about this mouse for the $35 or so I bought this for is that: Corded cable, grippy sides, comfort, precision laser, dpi toggle, logitech warranty, programmable buttons, and adjustable weight. You can't beat that at that price range! I am taking this to college later in the fall and I have no doubt that this will be a reliable mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Nice for everyday use too
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I occasionally game, but it works very well for an everyday mouse too-- just assign the buttons to functions like play/pause in your music player, forward/back in your browser, or whatever. The ability to select between clicky (granular) scrolling and smooth flick scrolling is wonderful. Uncertain how much use I'm going to get out of the ability to change DPI on the fly, but we'll see-- at the very least, it's nice to be able to adjust the default setting ticks for DPI. The weight insert means that no matter what kind of mouse you like, you'll find it a comfortable weight, and it's quite ergonomic. Highly recommended if you do any gaming or Photoshop work.
customer_reviews.author: Lux

customer_reviews.title: I wish they still made these
customer_reviews.text: This mouse lasted me years. I literally mean years. I ended up buying the next gen mouse, G502 because my G500 was soooo warn down due to thousands of hours of use. The G500 is easily the best mouse I've had so far. Although, the G502 does come close.
customer_reviews.author: Sevigor

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for about 4 years.
customer_reviews.text: It lasted about four years. The right Mouse button started the stick and feel gritty. I opened it up, cleaned it, but it didn't seem to make any difference. It's still functional but I ended up replacing it. It's too bad too cuz I really liked this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: xd
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a good mouse for the cost, but after a year of extensive gaming use, both mouse buttons started to get a bit,,, wonky? When holding the button(s) down, the mouse will register multiple clicks (or sometimes none at all) instead of thinking you're holding the button down. This results in single clicks counting as double or even triple-clicks, and anything that requires you to hold the mouse button down for longer than 2 seconds being extremely frustrating because the hold input stops working randomly. Probably easily fixed, but I'm not going to try anything until I already have a replacement, in case it breaks entirely.
customer_reviews.author: l0Peace0l

customer_reviews.title: Nice mouse
customer_reviews.text: The "ergonomics" of the mouse left a bit to be desired. The right side / pinky resting area could've had more room. I think the mouse being slightly larger would be very nice for my hands.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: After a year of use, the left click button seems to have broken. It often registers double-clicks when I click it once. Also, when I hold it down (to charge a weapon/spell in games for instance) it usually releases the click even though my finger is still done. It makes lockpicking in Elder Scrolls Online impossible. I did like the braided cord for durability. The weights were a nice gimmick but ultimately, I just got used to whatever I had in there and never bothered to change them again.
customer_reviews.author: Mostly Harmless

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Hands down my favorite mouse of all times, I am just sad that it is no longer being sold by Amazon or Logitech. Third party sellers only which want an arm and leg for it. I wish I had purchased a second one for back up but I think this will last a long time, fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Doc COS

customer_reviews.title: Near perfect replacement of my G5
customer_reviews.text: My G5 scroll wheel finally gave out. Very very sad day. I've had that moue for 5-6 years which is really impressive. The G500 has all the features I loved about my G5 and more, plus on downside pros Awesome play/shape/feel variable speed buttons Weight tray. God I love this SO much. Even if my kids and friends think I'm weird/full of it- screw them *WE* know, right? Smooth/Ratcheted scroll wheel. What a phenomenal idea. I love this. Full programmable like other Logitech(tm) mices cons the side where you rest your thumb has a gritty feel to it. annoys me, but tolerable. Might actually sand it down
customer_reviews.author: Right Reverend Rex

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse for any use.
customer_reviews.text: Hello, Bought this used, didn't feel like spending full price on it. Still and excellent mouse. Build very solid. Works great without a mat. I like the mouse heavier, nice to have extra weights. Very precise. Loads of buttons to do what you need to. Scrolwheel is very well made, nice scroll (odd thing to say, but it's a thing that sits in your hand 8+ hours a day, every little bit helps). It's very comfortable for office use as well. Recommended if price isn't steep for you. (otherwise consider G400, similar performance but no customizable weight).
customer_reviews.author: OmNomNomNom

customer_reviews.title: Still using it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse quite a while ago. I have been using it every day since I got it. I am using it for gaming and I like how easily configurable this mouse is. If it moves too fast, click a button on the mouse and it slows down, same for the opposite indeed. It's precision never let me down and I like the number of buttons (6) that can be used during games. Those are easily parametrable and recognized by most recent games. I did not use the weights because I could not really see the use for it but the idea is not bad. More specifically, it does not remove anything positive from the experience.
customer_reviews.author: Henri Savin

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse, love the wheel.
customer_reviews.text: At first the loose wheel had me a bit worried but then I pressed the button directly underneath the wheel and got it working perfectly (it makes the wheel not click so you can scroll down on long pages by flicking the wheel to make it roll for a bit). After a bit of using it, I truly like the design. I upgraded from my G500 which lasted me something like 7 years before the right mouse button stopped working, and this new mouse has Macro features to boot. Logitech's G series of mice have impressed me with their durability and I like the G500 so I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: random_hacker

customer_reviews.title: Owned for 2 years now - still comfortable and long-lasting!
customer_reviews.text: I have a dozen mice, including several wireless ones, but this one has been perfect for over 2 years now! The only thing that is semi-annoying is that I have cats that like to sleep on my mouse pad and sometimes fur gets up into the sensor, but it's easy to clean out. I didn't need to use the extra weights that came with the mouse - it worked fine right out of the box and still works as well as the day I got it. The adjustable sensitivity was not something I expected to use, but it definitely helps with first-person shooter gaming. Definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan W. Hilgeman

customer_reviews.title: On time
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and feels good. There is one problem, it has a possibility of hairs entering(hole) the laser sensor. It has no easy way to get to the laser sensor. With balls you can open it easy enough and with infrared mouse it is flat(no hole). Laser mice should just add it so we can open the bottom like the old ball mice with a twist.
customer_reviews.author: Firedragon

customer_reviews.title: This is my second favorite mouse of all time - right behind the Microsoft ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second favorite mouse of all time - right behind the Microsoft Explorer It fits your hand well, has great tracking ability even on my favorite surface - a frosty glass plate. It is awesome for gaming and has just enough buttons to not get in the way and still have full desktop and gaming pleasure. +Comfortable +Adjustable weights +Durable cable - braided! +tracks on pretty much everything and anything perfectly -tends to wear from years of use
customer_reviews.author: Brian Thorp

customer_reviews.title: best mouse
customer_reviews.text: this mouse is the best i have ever used, you can have 5 dpi sensitivities stored in the mouse and all you have to do is push a button and it changes for you. this is great for gaming when you need to change sensitivity depending on the game or style of gun you are using. this also has weights that make it feel real sturdy and i have max weight so my mouse doesnt feel like a light piece of plastic.really comfy and looks nice, the only thing bad about gaming mouses is the price. if your a gamer its worth it but if your not it still might be a great investment because of the feel and weights.
customer_reviews.author: Salik ali

customer_reviews.title: Just a replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for the same one. Had the first one for a couple years, and I'm surprised it lasted this long. When I'm online gaming, my friend calls me the "Hammer", I guess I do a lot of mouse Slamming whilst I do some serious Throwing Down on my daily dose of BF3. And after 2 years the wire inside the mouse started to loose connection or whatever. It served me well, well enough to get the same one again. Loved it, and Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kriple

customer_reviews.title: Mechanical flaw: Will eventually break.
customer_reviews.text: Mechanical flaw: Will eventually break. Bad ass mouse: awesome sensitivity and flexible settings. But they cheaped-out on the springs for the left/right buttons and it will eventually cause it malfunction to the point of being useless. Mine just double clicks all my actions, so it causes everything to cancel out. Don't buy it, common issue with these. Read up on it.
customer_reviews.author: Astro boii

customer_reviews.title: If you game, you will love this mouse
customer_reviews.text: Easy to configure, easy to use, 3 different DPI selections for sensitivity, comfortable to use and very responsive. Other keys and buttons can be configured to use in any particular game to perform different in-game functions. I use my side buttons for "strafe left" and "strafe right" and I use them a lot! So far, it is the best gaming mouse I have ever used, and I have gone through several. I guarantee you will enjoy using this mouse if you are a gamer!
customer_reviews.author: R. T. Petrin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Mouse w/ Adjustable Weight
customer_reviews.text: Just received this mouse yesterday. I ordered this mouse for my dad to use for general purpose computing, non-gaming. It came in a nice packaging. I love the texture finish on the mouse, It feels great in the hand and has a expensive feel to it. The adjustable weight is very nice and is very fun also. The mouse is very smooth and accurate. He is using the mouse on medium speed from the quick adjustable speed on the mouse. He loves this mouse very much and he is 62 right now in case you want to know. This is definitely a must buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I was stuck between this one and the G400, and some people still swear that the G400 is a better mouse. I for one am completely satisfied with the feel and everything about the mouse. I added in the heaviest weight because I prefer a heavy mouse, which is a nice option. The software is acceptable, but a little clunky. A really nice addition is the small button under the wheel is a lock for the wheel. If it is pressed in, it is like a normal wheel where you can feel the bump as it toggles. If you let it free though, you can spin it very rapidly. This option is great for scanning through large PDF files.
customer_reviews.author: SGTSHOOTnMISS

customer_reviews.title: ... to separate causing the mouse cord to come through like a hernia
customer_reviews.text: Within 2 weeks the plastic footpad started to peel off and within a 45 days the cable started to separate causing the mouse cord to come through like a hernia. That little bit of cord was getting caught on everything. I ended up cutting the protective sheathing and it's been a non problem since. Besides these 2 defects which don't effect my ability to pub stomp at all it is a great mouse. The ability to switch dpi, the scroll lock, and the 3 buttons on the side have made using my computer so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Markle

customer_reviews.title: It got really annoying for gaming because double clicks perform different tasks and ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked for a few months but then it started doing this strange thing where it processed a single click as a double click. It got really annoying for gaming because double clicks perform different tasks and it became impossible to perform the single click task with this mouse. If you're not gaming or anything like that this mouse will be reasonable, but otherwise you might want to shop around.
customer_reviews.author: Zach G

customer_reviews.title: 2nd mouse
customer_reviews.text: I've had this mouse for 5 years and just recently it started to lose sensitivity a little when I click and drag my right mouse button. It was only logical to buy this mouse again the 2nd time. As an avid gamer (20+ hours a week), I don't notice a lot of wear on the mouse because of it's design texture. My 5 year old mouse and the new mouse that I ordered is identical aesthetically. It has 10 preset buttons, definitely worth it if it'll last you a good few years.
customer_reviews.author: L. Dablinski

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Fast Shipping, Excellent Experience.
customer_reviews.text: The product was great! It looked great, worked great, and very easy to use. Even though the Product shipped a little later than the other item (Logitech G110), they still both arrived at the same time on the expected date. The packaging looked solid when arrived. The price on Amazon was actually cheaper than that of Newegg and TigerDirect! I shop online all the time and compare prices all the time. I know a good deal when I see one! Can't go wrong with the G500 and Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Wong

customer_reviews.title: Can't reconfigure the Left-Click button
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse for ONE reason and ONE reason only. I saw phrases like "10 reconfigurable buttons", "totally reconfigurable buttons", "totally reprogrammable" etc, etc. Now I discover that you can do nothing with the Left-Click button. All I wanted was a fast Auto-repeat on my Left-Click button. Do you mean to tell me that at this late date, no "Gaming Mouse" maker has figured out the need to provide that? That is just sick, sad and deplorable. Good God! I'm getting sick now.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Dosnt track well
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this mouse for 3 months now. At first it tracked very well. Now it is very spotting, often difficult to move smoothly across the screen. It often gets stuck and has to be picked up and re positioned. The buttons on it are very well placed and are easily customized. The ability to change your dpi on the fly with buttons is great. You can even set how much it changes based on every preset. You can have up to 5 presets dpi levels. Overall I really enjoyed the mouse but the lousy tracking which is the most important job of the mouse makes me unable to recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and convenience
customer_reviews.text: My G500 is used as a precision instrument, in both gaming and general computing. I keep mine set to the top setting, full 3500dpi, and it works like a charm - a full 360 in a few inches in most games. It feels comfortable, the adjustable weight does well (though it's a pain to change - get your prying instrument ready), and the unlock-able wheel makes for some amusement when idle in games (or convenient if you like smooth mouse scrolling - I like discrete steps for weapon switching). It looks like a professional device, not a status symbol like my old Death Adder. And, unlike the Death Adder, it doesn't get visibly filthy. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: It's everything you want it to be.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far hands down one of the best gaming mice I've owned. The braided cord definitely give the cord a feel of durability. It is thinner then I expected it to be, that's a good thing, so it's not as hard to rout and/or hide. The ability to customize the weight of the mouse is another amazing feature. It feels perfect in my hand just the right heft and friction resistance. Adjustable DPI ties everything together nicely, I can get just the right amount of precision and speed I need regardless of what I'm doing.
customer_reviews.author: Jake R Yde

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and comfortable mouse
customer_reviews.text: It has a number of really nice features without being a super gizmo. Well made, very responsive and the adjustable DPI is a dream in Planetside 2 (high DPI for dogfights, low DPI for precision aiming, etc.). The switchable scroll wheel is also something that I never knew I needed. The weights I'm not so sold on, I just threw a random bunch in and never touched it again. But I just put the rest of the weights in the drawer so its hardly getting in the way of anything. My last mouse was uncomfortable to hold and my pinky was jammed up against the table but this one is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Cuastomizable
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Adjustable weighs for your personal comfort and also DPI for certain games. Can Set hot keys with the software that comes with it to have certain profiles with certain games. Has a break on the wheel so you can have it click if your going up or down. Take it off and you can FLY all the way to the bottom of a page that your on. Perfect mouse for must gamers for the price. Cons: Not one darn thing Overall: must have!
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Even better than the G9x mouse...
customer_reviews.text: As an owner of the G9x mouse I always thought the even tough that mouse is great didn't deserve the place as best gaming mouse ever. I tried the G500 and felt a instant improvement in ergonomics as in the performance as well. I bought the G500 only because of the great ergonomics feature but had second thoughts about if being actually better in gaming performance as the G9x. To my surprise the G500 is even more responsive than the G9x and runs smoother. The G500 is a great every day mouse AND also a great specialized gaming mouse. The best of BOTH WORLDS.
customer_reviews.author: insoc

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse I've ever had for gaming!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse about a month ago to replace another Logitech G5 mouse I owned due to bending the USB input and causing it to not function properly. I'm glad I did! I primarily use the mouse for online gaming playing LOTRO and WOW among others. It is even more precise than the old G5 I used with more programmable buttons (10) and the added dual-mode scrolling allows me to zoom in and out with even greater ease than before. The weights also fit in even more snug due to a redesign of the holder for them. I highly recommend this mouse to anyone who is a gamer! 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Eric J. Nivala

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up! on the G500
customer_reviews.text: I owned the G5 that I just loved!! but after 5 years it went bad so I bought the MX518 and I just wanted to through that thing away, it felt cheap, so I went and got the G500 after reading good reviews on it and I can say that I love this mouse, its the best mouse I have ever owned yet (next to the G5). Love it all the way, it feels expensive and I can tell this will last for sure!! very well built with extremely high quality materials. Once you own a G5 or a G500 you dont want anything else.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tapia

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: Its a very accurate mouse with a lot of customizable buttons and dpi you can adjust on the fly to increase or decrease sensitivity. There are also weights to give you the resistance you prefer when pushing your mouse around. I find this mouse to be extremely comfortable to my hand and I have always had great experience with logitech products. Scrollwheel is extremely smooth and the only complaint I have is that back and forward buttons on the mouse are a smidge higher than I would like them to be. Its not the greatest mouse on the market but for what I paid it was a great value. 4.5/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for over a month now and continue to like it more and more. I bought it for counter strike source and for 3 reasons. 1 needed a new mouse (old was mx518), 2 to keep your exact sensitivity when going to a lan and 3 the extra buttons for binds. Unluckily enough the only buttons that you can bind are still mouse4 and mouse5. The hyper wheel is really cool and a great feature. The weights are a great feature. Con is with my steelseries QTK mouse pad it is verrry smooth but sometimes I feel a slight hesitation before it moves. mouse pad or mouse? not sure. Great product, love Logitech mouses.
customer_reviews.author: Leikeze

customer_reviews.title: great gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: not a fan of the design, i took mine apart and painted teh speckled part white. matches my white g15 and my white level 10 gt case. mouse itself is amazing, weight adjustable, buttons work amazingly well, scroll wheel is a must have, i love it for surfing long wiki pages or facebook. flies through 50 pages at a time or more. dpi settings are great and customizable. overall this is a great mouse, check out ebay for hurricane mouse feet, makes the mouse track like its on ice, almost no friction.
customer_reviews.author: G. Brown

customer_reviews.title: I didn't care for it
customer_reviews.text: I returned it. -I found the scroll wheel to be so loose that it would turn by itself if I moved the mouse too quickly or a little suddenly. I didn't care for things scrolling when I didn't want them too. -I also didn't care for the shape of the mouse. I prefer my mice to be a little flatter. The more rounded shape of this mouse made it uncomfortable in my hands. -The grimy feel of the non-slip sides. -Some of the button placement didn't work for me either.
customer_reviews.author: Primo

customer_reviews.title: After years of use, this mouse replaced another.  It's better.
customer_reviews.text: As a gamer of significant experience and time-investment, my husband is extra picky about his mouses--mice?--his magical pointer-thingy. I am told that this is good because it's weighted and you can adjust the weight to your preference. It's accurate and allows him to select or explode many things at his whim. I haven't heard him slam it on the desk once--and that's a vast improvement over the last one.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mouse I purchased for my brother. After seeing it in action, my roommate purchased one for himself as well. This appears to be a newer generation of a mouse I bought ages ago. It is much more refined and has more buttons than my "old" gen one. My mouse is still rocking on and working great, so I haven't upgraded. But my brother and roommate have spoken highly about their use of this mouse and so I'll pass on the glowing reviews to here. Keep up the great mice Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Buggy software
customer_reviews.text: The mouse software is buggy. It doesn't map the buttons properly. For example, I tried to map 2 buttons to Copy and Paste. They only work when using standard keyboard layouts, but since I use Dvorak, it doesn't work. This is an elementary programming error and the old software on XP with my mx500 worked much better. I'm using the latest available software Setpoint 5.46.10 and driver version 5.33.14. Why is it so hard to find a product that works as advertised these days?
customer_reviews.author: R590

customer_reviews.title: Cable snaps off easily
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse for FPS gaming. It shape fits the hand well and is comfortable. It's fatal flaw is that the cable will kink and snap VERY easily with regular use. If you take caution not to bend the flimsy cable where it is connected to the mouse it will last awhile. If it's allowed to flex at the mouse it's just a matter of time before it just snaps right off. This is my 3rd one due to broken cables and Logitech does not warranty the cable.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mouse.
customer_reviews.text: I have large hands, and sometimes it's hard to find a good mouse. This mouse works perfectly for me. I generally use the heaviest weight and leave it set at 3/4 sensitivity for normal operations, particularly MMO's and spreadsheet work. The cord is long and the wheel can be changed from free-spinning to clicky. Not too many buttons but the ones that it has are well placed for reaching them and the customization options work well (at least under Windows 7 and 8).
customer_reviews.author: Gerald J. Wyckoff

customer_reviews.title: Love this Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse with great customization options. It allows you to do a lot but not so much that it's overwhelming, is comfortable to use for long periods of time, and has just enough buttons that I'm not overwhelmed but enough that my husband loves it, too. We both have one--he bought one that he ended up letting me use (he's so nice!) and when his mouse was on its last legs I bought him one for Christmas. We both still love ours and I would buy it again if I needed a new gaming mouse in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Aubree

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I've used several top end mice in the last 5 or so years, and this one is my current favorite. I decided to go back to wired, because I was tired of changing out the batteries every month or two(I use my computer a lot) and am glad that I did. I like extra weights that they give you. Gives the mouse a more solid feel. Great response and although it is meant for gaming, I bought it for Photoshop use and love the ability to change mouse sensitivity on the fly.
customer_reviews.author: Serj

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse ever
customer_reviews.text: Don't get Razer chinese junk that breaks in two months of solid use, or MS crap mouse, or any other gaming mouse. THe problem with all gaming mice is that the software is garbage. Logitech also suffers from this but it sucks far less than Mionix/Razer/MadCatz/etc. Also this mouse has the infinite scroll wheel option, which is indispensable for browsing and day to day use (trust me). Logitech also has the G800 MMO mouse which is just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Vapenaysh

customer_reviews.title: Palm-grip heaven
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through 4 of these mice due to my macaw's strange appetite for plastic, and even though the price is a bit high, I would never consider buying a cheaper offering. Logitech's configuration software is simple and intuitive, and the comfortable, textured grip is perfect. Having a total of 8 customizable buttons (not including the dpi adjustment buttons) is just perfect for MMO's such as World of Warcraft.
customer_reviews.author: Flashlight nerd

customer_reviews.title: The best mouse ever made.
customer_reviews.text: I wish they still made it. Have had mine for over 5 years of hard use. One of the best parts is the adjustable weight, because it rides low in the frame and makes the mouse feel more stable.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan walsh

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: I went from the original Razer DeathAdderto this mouse and it is great. I never used any of the weights which adds to much weight to the mouse. The mouse has plenty of USB cable length and it has a great feel for grip. It is not a rubber feel but a hard plastic feel. the texture on the mouse is really cool to. This mouse is amazing. Buttons are high quality. CONS: 5700 DPI is not needed in any game. I usually play BF3 and at 5700 DPI it is just to much.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Steinberg

customer_reviews.title: whereas my older Microsoft Intellimouse Explorer had a MUCH better ergonomic design that fit my palm more comfortably
customer_reviews.text: I have fairly large hands, and this mouse is just too round to be considered ergonomic. I've been using it for a long time now and I think that it's contributed to some carpal tunnel problems for me, whereas my older Microsoft Intellimouse Explorer had a MUCH better ergonomic design that fit my palm more comfortably. The middle mouse button is difficult as well, to the point where I've just had to disable it completely.. I like the three side buttons and the scroll wheel, but overall I would not recommend this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Wire went bad after a year
customer_reviews.text: The wire went bad (wouldn't work unless you wiggled it into the right place) after about a year. I did carry this around in my backpack so that could've had something to do with the wire going bad earlier than expected. Thankfullly I had purchased a 2 year insurance plan. The mouse is awesome and programmable but I'd recommend investing in an insurance plan with SquareTrade or Assurant!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gaming mouse, but Logitech packages the cord bent and tied so the cord isn't very reliable. I've also worn out several of the left-click buttons and it will "depress" even though I'm physically holding down the button. Logitech has been good about replacing them, but it is a pain. Despite this, it's a solid mouse for gamers and businessmen alike.
customer_reviews.author: Xack

customer_reviews.title: G500 Mouse - fantasic!
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse! Has an amazing feel to it and fits to my hand perfectly. I'd say i have an average-sized hand. The DPI settings work great on the fly! The preset sensitivity levels are nice and work great with my current games. The cord is made of strong material and won't fray over time. The cord length is plenty long. The programming buttons are in the perfect positions. I recommend this to any casual gamer.
customer_reviews.author: sebasw9

customer_reviews.title: Solid 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Feels good, heavy, you can make it extra heavy adding included set of weights. The scroll switch is amazing. How many times I wished I had that on long forums or just super long pages. And a DPI switch is handy as well. Build quality is OK now only time will tell about its durability. Hopefully it won't die, my previous G400 mouse gave up on its right button. I really hope this will live long to see Logitech's next G-generation wonder.
customer_reviews.author: Jin Champloo

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse has lots of buttons that are easy to reach. It also comes with great and easy to use software. It's great for MMO players, that don't want to deal with ridiculous mice that have a full keypad. If what you want is above, let me be the 1st to congratulate you. You've found your new mouse. Off Topic: I'll never be able to figure out why scroll-wheel tilt-keys aren't a standard feature for mice. Every Mouse should have them.
customer_reviews.author: dfgdsfdsgbdf

customer_reviews.title: I like having a mouse with no cord
customer_reviews.text: A little bit too sensitive on the mousing clicking. Where the thumb rest, the material wore out within a couple of months. I contacted logitech and they sent me out a new one. I bought the G602 and use that now. Its worth the extra money and there is no noticeable lag. I like having a mouse with no cord.
customer_reviews.author: S. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Ergo unfriendly and short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Used this mouse for roughly a year and a half. Eventually the left mouse button ceased functioning entirely. Attempts to fix the mouse myself led to disaster. Ive since talked with a few friends and co workers, and all of them have reported the same thing happening in the first 2 years of life. Great mouse while it worked, just don't expect it to last.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any specific mice that I could compare this one to, but it feels real good for gaming and just everyday use. It is a little bit more expensive than an "Everyday" mouse, but I think it was worth it. Being able to customize the weight is a very nice feature as well. With the included software, you're able to customize what the buttons do, even to excute macros which you can make yourself. Lots of amazing features for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Cats Go Nyan

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I've really enjoyed this mouse since purchased. I spend a good 3+ hours a day with this mouse. I like the weights a lot, I don't use all of them, but it makes a big difference and helps keep the mouse from lifting up as you move it quickly. Size was perfect and that is often a problem. I wear XL gloves, and while my pinky doesn't rest on the mouse, my hand as a whole fits well. No hand cramps even after extended usage.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have this mouse for very long before the cord started developing a kink in it. When it arrived in the mail, the cord was already pretty bent but I thought that if I flattened it out and made sure to keep it straight, that it wouldn't get any worse. This mouse is really nice and smooth and I love how it feels in my hands and with the weights, but I was really upset that it didn't last long because of the cord. Very disappointing as I usually prefer logitech products over others.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole H

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I've had the MX518 mouse and this is a good upgrade it does all what I wanted am a gamer and I realy like the dpi 5700 but in real gaming u don't need that fast dpi the dual scrool wheel is a realy awosome feature + weight adjusting pros : - great design that fits your hand precisly - buttons are easy to reach - High quality - cons : - none exept the packaging could be more exciting than this I hope I helped you
customer_reviews.author: SymphonyOfLife

customer_reviews.title: Love this mouse
customer_reviews.text: Love this mouse.. I 've had it for 4 years and it has developed some weird double clicking problem. Too bad, because this thing is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: dylan jeffery

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mouse. I didn't think I needed the DPI adjuster, but now I find myself using it all the time. Great for moving from spreadsheets to gaming, for instance. Mouse has held up for almost a year now, which is unusual for me - I am apparently very, very hard on mice. My only gripe would be that the weights are uneeded. I removed them all, and haven't added them back.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H

customer_reviews.title: This isn't the type of mouse Jerry would chase.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and feel of this mouse. I have pretty fat, above average (not an NBA player) sized hands. My only complaint is occasionally the mouse get's a little shaker or can double click on it's own. Very rarely though. All around a great non serious gamer mouse. DPI makes it plenty fast. I do wish the buttons had slightly better placement though.
customer_reviews.author: Error Message

customer_reviews.title: If you're computer nerd friends say you need a new mouse (dell/hp mouse) get this one, they will be proud.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously they will be. And you'll be proud of yourself for such an awesome purchase. One of the cheapest mice in the industry built out of pure quality and demons. The angels of heaven will smite the demon but the demon will rise and say "G500 sucka" No but in all seriousness: this mouse is pretty sweet. You'll find yourself using the dpi setting much more than you anticipated. The weights it comes with makes the flow of movement like sex on a rainbow. Just get it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Schwan

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay. Get a Razer Deathadder 2013 Edition instead
customer_reviews.text: This mouse feels really good the first time you use it but over time it does not maintain that same feel of quality and precision. Your fingers are smushed into each other on the right side and the braided cable can split in some areas. Even though it was $38 at the time, I wish I had bought a Razer Deathadder 2013 Edition. That mouse is much better, and the rubber in the side of it feels really good.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Best mid range gaming mouse. Good for palm grip users.
customer_reviews.text: Even though it doesn't look as cool as the deathadder or sensei, its main 2 contenders, the G500 is great. I used the deathadder before this, and even though it looked nice, it's grip felt unnatural to me as a palm gripper. I love the convenient buttons for changing sensitivity, macro buttons, the button the controls the smooth/rough scroll wheel, and how you can adjust the weight. If you don't care about mouse aesthetics and are looking for a reliable, well rounded mouse get this. Also, I recommend the extra for this over the G400 because of the stronger cable.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan Dam

customer_reviews.title: Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using this mouse for about a week and it is awesome. I have very large hands and this thing is is comfortable for me. The button to let the scroll wheel actually comes in handy. I didnt think I would use it but I do. There are two buttons to raise or lower the dpi. It is good for shooters who like to be a sniper so you can slow the mouse down to aim more precisely. There are some lights to indicate dpi level which is handy for a quick glance. There are also a few programable buttons. So far I really like this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse, not accurate description
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse, I personally can only use large mice, and I prefer for them to be weighty. The mouse fits very comfortably in my hand, and the variable weights allow me set the mouse's weight perfectly. The 3 DPI settings are well spaced, and the button placements are very convenient. The only reason I can't give this 5 stars, is because in the description, it states that there are 12 programmable buttons, which is not true. There are 6 programmable buttons, (8 if you include the left and right mouse buttons). Three on the left side, and 3 on the middle mouse. If they change the description, then this is a great 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Watters

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent choice for a gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent choice for a gaming mouse. I play mostly fps with this and it fits my need perfectly. The adjustable dpi is great for rapidly changing aiming environments. The scroll wheel can be set to smooth scroll or click scroll. The mouse is very durable. With rough use and moving it lasted 3 years before the usb became loose where it meets the mouse and stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer of Goods

customer_reviews.title: precise mouse
customer_reviews.text: I use this mouse mostly for photo editing and it's very precise. I especially like the ability to slow down the mouse cursor speed to get precise control and like earlier models, it comes with a nice removable weight tray. It's very ergonomic and the programmable buttons are easily accessible. It's not just for gaming but works wonders for photo editing or general internet browsing as well
customer_reviews.author: gameguru1360

customer_reviews.title: Performs wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: This is the first gaming mouse that I have purchased and it has been a good one. The mouse is easy to hold and has many options to choose from (weight, DPI precision and button configurations). The SetPoint software is also easy to use and setup custom profiles. The mouse performs wonderfully and tracks very well. I've never had it skip or bounce. I am very pleased with the mouse, its performance and the ability for customization which it has. Great intro to gaming mice. I had considered a Razer Imperperator over this mouse, but the lower price and larger amount of features Logitech offered swayed me.
customer_reviews.author: Jennaron

customer_reviews.title: Not that great.
customer_reviews.text: It needs a better design for the middle button. It breaks so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Zhang

customer_reviews.title: G500...Nice Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a gamer but rather a CAD PCB designer and I use this mouse at least 10 hours a day if not more and have no real complaints aside from the middle scrolling wheel is a little sensitive for me. If the sensitivity was adjustable, I would have given it a good solid 5 stars. The mouse fits in my hand just right I also liked that I was able to add weight to the mouse and the adjustable accuracy settings come in real handy.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: 4 years and 8 months of daily use
customer_reviews.text: After 4 years and 8 months of daily use the left button died. This was a good buy and I'd get it again if it was available.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Zlatanov / Теодор Златанов

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Still using this mouse many months later after purchasing it. It really is a wonderful mouse. I love the customizable weights. This is a great mouse and well worth the money spent!
customer_reviews.author: ZiRiS

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last imo
customer_reviews.text: It didn't last long, especially for the price I paid. It suffered the same L click issue that many of us had. I loved it until it started missing clicks. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: neopolaris

product_meta.title: Logitech G500 Programmable Gaming Mouse
product_meta.description:
The Logitech Gaming Mouse G500 is your weapon of choice for precision and control. Gaming-grade laser gives you game-changing precision at any hand speed (from 200 to 5700 dpi). Onboard memory lets you save and take your settings for your favorite title with you - no software required. Plus, weight tuning for personalized feel and control.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


The Logitech Gaming Mouse G500. Your weapon of choice.

When it comes to gaming, the smallest details can make a difference between winning and losing. 

The Logitech Gaming Mouse G500 provides unparalleled precision, control, and comfort. It offers a gaming-grade laser that allows for smooth precision at any hand speed. Onboard memory lets you take your settings for your favorite titles wherever you go – with no added software. Personalized weight tuning of up to 27 grams gives you the feel you want and more control. The dual-mode scroll wheel provides click-to-click scrolling that's perfect for weapon selecting in games and the hyper-fast scrolling is ideal for flying through long web pages. On-the-fly adjustable dpi allows for precision targeting (200 dpi) to lightning fast maneuvers (up to 5700 dpi). And 10 programmable buttons gives you the ability to outmaneuver your opponent. The game is in your hands. 




KEY FEATURES




Gaming grade laser offers smooth precision
A gaming-grade laser gives you game-changing precision at any hand speed, making it your weapon of choice for MMORPG and FPS gamers. 



Powerful onboard memory
Onboard memory lets you save and take your settings for your favorite title with you – and no added software is required.



Weight tuning gives you options
Whether you like it heavy or light, weight tuning gives you up to 27 grams of extra weight for personalized feel and control. Just the way you like it. 



Dual-mode scroll wheel with hyper-fast scrolling
This unique feature provides precise click-to-click scrolling that gamers love to have on their side. Or when the boss is coming, switch to frictionless hyper-fast scrolling to fly through Web pages.

On-the-fly adjustable DPI 
This option gives you the right level of precision for any game scenario – (up to 5700 dpi ) for whatever game you're playing.

Programmable buttons put macros in your hand
10 programmable buttons give you valuable macros at your disposal (which means downloading Logitech SetPoint software). 






CHECK OUT THE G-SERIES
FROM LOGITECH:

Logitech G35 Surround Sound Headset
Powered by Dolby technology, the G35 headset delivers detailed 7.1 surround sound. Convenient on-ear controls give you quick access to key audio features. 

Logitech Gaming Headset G330
With its adjustable, behind-the-head design, pressure-relieving silicone lining, and pivoting ear pads, the Logitech Gaming Headset G330 delivers comfort that won't quit. 

Logitech G9x Laser Mouse
With interchangeable grips, customizable weights, and adjustable mouse settings that are stored in onboard memory, the G9X Laser Mouse lets you personalize your entire gaming experience.

Logitech G13 Advanced Gameboard
The G13 advanced gameboard gives you game-changing comfort and control. Naturally contoured design follows the natural shape of your hand and fingers for increased comfort during long sessions.

Logitech G19 Gaming Keyboard
Giving you an arsenal of advanced gaming technology, the G19 features a color GamePanel LCD to display game stats, VOIP communication data, and many other items.

Logitech G15 Gaming Keyboard
Get an edge over the competition with unprecedented communication and control, thanks to programmable G-keys and an integrated LCD that displays key game information.






WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Package Contents Logitech Gaming Mouse G500 Adjustable Weight Cartridge Tuning weights and case User documentation 3-year limited hardware warranty 

System Requirements Windows XP, Windows Vista, or Windows 7 USB port Internet Connection for software download Gaming-grade specifications:
Tracking Resolution: 200 – 5700 dpi
Image processing: 12 megapixels/second
Max. acceleration: 30G* 
Max. speed: up to 165 inches(4.19 m)/second* 

Responsiveness
USB data format: 16 bits/axis
USB report rate: Up to 1000 reports/second
Sleep mode: Disabled 

Glide
Dynamic coefficient of friction – Mu (k): 0.09**
Static coefficient of friction – Mu (s): 0.14**
Tuning weight: Up to 27 grams 

Durability 
Buttons (Left / Right): 8 million clicks
Feet: 250 kilometers *Tested on most popular gaming-mousepad surfaces
** Tested on wood-veneer desktop.
feature_bullets: Gaming-grade laser gives you precision at any speed
Up to 27 grams of extra weight give you the feel you want in your hand
Onboard memory lets you take your settings with you
Dual mode scroll wheel provides click-to-click or hyper-fast scrolling
On-the-fly adjustable DPI gives you the right level of precision for any game scenario. Mouse also comes with 10 programmable buttons

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,263 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
